ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about various diseases and public health issues in Spanish
Medical vocabulary and knowledge about various conditions.
I practiced oral and written Spanish communication, particularly in the context of medicine.
I learned a lot of different types of medical terms and concepts in spanish

I was able to improve my Spanish vocabulary and speech in the context of diseases, treatments, public health issues/concerns, and the various economic, social, and biological aspects of different medical problems.
I learned about different medical diseases, terminology and health issues in Spanish. I improved my Spanish speaking and writing skills
I gained a lot of confidence in my Spanish writing abilities and my knowledge of Spanish medical terms.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I enjoyed the variety of topics that we covered, and liked the in class presentations. Professor Carreras cared a lot about her students and I always looked forward to going to class.
Professor is very kind
Good course for practice in writing, we wrote a lot a week. Also interesting presentations.
It is well-facilitated, but I think more low pressure speaking opportunities would make it better.

Profesora Carreras is very nice and cares about her students deeply. She always wanted to make the class fun and encouraged students to interact. The material was also relevant and interesting and the workload was just right.

This course did not work over zoom. The lectures were very boring, and made worse by the fact that they were at 9am. The professor treated the class as a lecture instead of a discussion based language class

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Virtual live lectures were very engaging.
Language classes are hard over Zoom, but Prof. Carreras did a good job engaging the class.
She's super flexible and caring for her students, and genuinely just wanted us to learn while making sure we were doing alright.

The PowerPoint slides were interesting, but at times it was hard to stay engaged when the class consisted of going through a presentation. There were a few breakout rooms that helped me get to know my classmates better, and I think more of these would encourage people to turn on their cameras more and stay more focused during the class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, this course gave a good overview of a variety of medical topics in Spanish.
Yes, if you want an interesting course with not too much work.
Yes, it is a fun class where the work is constant but never overwhelming. Prof Carreras is great too!
Yes! Really cool material, and not very time consuming so it's a great 5th class for anyone who whose interested in a lowkey class that they can still enjoy

Yes Professor Carreras is very thorough in her presentation of medical issues and explores it through different mediums such as power point presentation, podcasts, Ted talks, online videos, and more. She also invites students to engage with the material by reading related articles and giving their own opinions while simultaneously learning about insightful public health matters.
Yes! It was fun and the content will be very useful to anyone going into a medical profession
Not if it is virtual

Definitely! Although it was somewhat hard to stay engaged due to the online format, the homework assignments helped me practice my writing skills and use the medical terms we learned in context. It wasn't stressful as an online class, and there weren't any quizzes or exams throughout the course. You'll get out of it what you put in, especially when it comes to participating in class because she does not force anyone to speak and allows people to volunteer when they feel comfortable.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: live virtual lecture
Live virtual lecture and asynchronous days.
Live virtual zoom class
